oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Recognizing Common Infectious Diseases of Small Ruminants
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Smith, Mary C.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: lymphadenitis
paratuberculosis
ovine progressive pneumonia
arthritis-encephalitis
soremouth
keratoconjunctivitis
foot rot
chronic diseases
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Caseous lymphadenitis, paratuberculosis, ovine progressive pneumonia, caprine arthritis-encephalitis, soremouth, infectious keratoconjunctivitis and foot rot are important infectious diseases of small ruminants. Although diagnosis is often based on clinical signs alone, laboratory testing to detect subclinically infected animals and culling or segregation are required for control or eradication of the more chronic diseases.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2005; 128-132
